turns.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
turns.text: Where to, madame?

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Can you recommend a restaurant?

turns.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
turns.text: Well, there's Pruniers if you care for seafood. If you want to lunch in the Bois, there's...

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Where do you eat?

turns.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
turns.text: At PÃ¨re Mathieu's.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Where is that?

turns.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
turns.text: It's just a place for workmen.

turns.speaker: NINOTCHKA
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
turns.text: Eight blocks down in the Rue de Poivrel.

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: Your Highness.

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: How do you do, my friend.

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: Your Highness, forgive this intrusion, but...

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: What is it, Rakonin? Did you lose your job?

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: No, madame, something of the utmost importance... it concerns your jewels.

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: My jewels?!

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: I remember one birthday of His Majesty, our beloved Czar... I had the honor of being on guard at the summer palace... I still see you bending before His Majesty... You wore your diadem and a necklace... your face seemed to be lighted by the jewels.

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: Why do you bring this up after so many years?

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: They are here!... Your jewels!... Here in Paris!

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: Alexis! Do you know what you are saying?

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: This morning three Soviet agents arrived. I overheard a telephone conversation with Mercier, the jeweler. Your Highness, they are going to sell them!

turns.speaker: RAKONIN
turns.text: I am sorry... I have to leave.

turns.speaker: SWANA
turns.text: Thank you so much, my friend. I will get in touch with you.

turns.speaker: BUZHARDT
turns.text: Sir, the charges are serious -- first, abuse of power; second, obstruction of justice; third, failure to cooperate with Congress; and last, bombing Cambodia ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: They can't impeach me for bombing Cambodia.  The President can bomb anybody he wants.

turns.speaker: BUZHARDT
turns.text: Sir, if I may ... echo my concern ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Then tell Richardson to fire him.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: You're lawyers.  How can you let this shit go by!  Look!  This?  Nixon can't say this.

turns.speaker: BUZHARDT
turns.text: You did say it, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Never.  I never said that about Jews!

turns.speaker: BUZHARDT
turns.text: We could check the tape again, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: You don't need to check the tape.  I know what I said.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: For Christ's sake, it soils my mother's memory.  Do you think I want the whole goddamn world to see my mother like this?  Raising a dirty mouth!

turns.speaker: BUZHARDT
turns.text: But sir, we'll have to start over from the beginning.  We don't have the staff to ...

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: Mr. President, I don't know what to say.  As soon as we learned from the Secret Service you were en route, the Director was notified.  He should be here any minute.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Where the hell is he?

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: Uh, he's rushing back from his tennis game, sir ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: So ... let's go ...

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: He told me to take you to his conference room.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No.  His office.  I want a very private conversation.  I don't want to be bugged.

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: Then his office will be fine.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: How's the job coming, Bob?

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: Frankly, sir, it stinks.  I have no access.  I'm lucky Helms lets me have a staff.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We'll see about that ...

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: He's nervous, sir.  He's heard you're looking for a new director.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Well, he certainly isn't acting like it.

turns.speaker: CUSHMAN
turns.text: That's Helms.  He's "sang froid," a world-class poker player.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Yeah?  Well, I own the fucking casino.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The bigger problem I see is this guy who was arrested, McCord -- James McCord -- he headed up security for the Committee to Re-Elect.  He turns out to be ex-CIA.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: "Ex-CIA"?  There's no such thing as "ex-CIA," John -- they're all Ivy League Establishment.  Is he one of these guys with a beef against us?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: So, what about those Watergate clowns, John?  This fuck Sirica's crazy. Thirty-five-year sentences!  There were no weapons.  Right?  No injuries. There was no success!  It's just ridiculous.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Sirica's just trying to force one of them to testify.  But they're solid.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Then what about this Washington Post crap?  Woodwind and Fernstein?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Mr. President, Hunt wants more money. Another hundred-and-thirty thousand.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: He says if he doesn't get it right away, he's going to blow us out of the water.  And he means it.  Ever since his wife died in the plane crash, he's been over the edge.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Pay him.  Pay him what he wants.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Executive clemency ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Hunt has nothing to lose now.  Pardon all of them.  Nobody's going to investigate a crime for which the criminals have already been pardoned.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I like that.  That's a solution.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Mitchell?  Mitchell's ... family.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Either it goes to Mitchell or it comes here.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: How much do you need?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Uh, I would say these people are going to cost a million dollars over the next two years ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We could get that.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Uh huh ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We could get a million dollars.  We could get it in cash.  I know where it could be gotten.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm still not confident we can ride through this.  Some people are going to have to go to jail.  Hunt's not the only problem.  Haldeman let me use the $350,000 cash fund in his safe to make the payments.  Ehrlichman had a role, a big role, in the Ellsberg break-in. And I'm ... uh, I think it's time we begin to think in terms of cutting our losses.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: You say, John, cut our losses and all the rest.  But suppose the thing blows and they indict Bob and the others. Jesus, you'd never recover from that, John.  It's better to fight it out instead, and not let people testify ...

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Sir, I still don't think, uh, we can contain it anymore.  There's a cancer on the presidency.  And it's growing. With every day that ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Jesus, everything is a crisis among the upper intellectual types, the softheads.  The average people don't think it's much of a crisis.  For Christ's sake, it's not Vietnam ... no one's dying here.  Isn't it ridiculous?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I agree it's ridiculous but --

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I mean, who the hell cares about this penny-ante shit.  Goldwater put it right.  He said: "Well for Christ's sake, everybody bugs everybody else; we know that." ... It's the cover-up, not the deed that's really bad here.  If only Mitchell could step up and take the brunt of it; give them the hors d'oeuvre and maybe they won't come back for the main course.  That's the tragedy of all this.  Mitchell's going to get it in the neck anyway. It's time he assumed some responsibility.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: He's right.  Maybe it's time to go to the hang-out route, John.  A full and thorough investigation ... We've cooperated with the FBI, we'll cooperate with the Senate.  What do we have to hide?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: No, we have nothing to hide.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We have nothing to hide.  But the only flaw in the plan is that they're not going to believe the truth.  That is the incredible thing!

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: You want me to put it all in writing? Over my signature?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Nobody knows more about this thing than you do, John.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I'm not going to be the scapegoat for this.  Haldeman and Ehrlichman are in just as deep as me.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: John, you don't want to start down that road.  I remember what Whittaker Chambers told me back in '48 -- and he was a man who suffered greatly -- he said, "On the road of the informer, it's always night."  This is beyond you or even me.  It's the country, John.  It's the presidency.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I understand that, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Good.  You know how I feel about loyalty.  I'm not going to let any of my people go to jail.  That I promise you.  The important thing is to keep this away from Haldeman and Ehrlichman. I'm trusting you to do that, John.  I have complete confidence in you.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I was sorry to hear about your wife.

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: Yes ... I got the money.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: The President would like to know if that was the last payment.

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: I'll bet he would.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: In Richard Nixon's long history of underhanded dealings, he has never gotten better value for his money.  If I were to open my mouth, all the dominoes would fall.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: How the hell do you have the temerity to blackmail the President of the United States?

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: That's not the question, John.  The question is: Why is he paying?

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: To protect his people.

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: I'm one of his people.  The Cubans are his people.  And we're going to jail for him.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: Howard, you'll serve no more than two years, then he'll pardon you.

turns.speaker: HUNT
turns.text: John, sooner or later -- sooner, I think -- you are going to learn the lesson that has been learned by everyone who has ever gotten close to Richard Nixon.  That he's the darkness reaching out for the darkness.  And eventually, it's either you or him. Look at the landscape of his life and you'll see a boneyard.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It was her wrist.  And it was through a plate-glass door.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Anyway, they had to take her to Bellevue.  Maybe she'll stay this time.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Let's not forget they're just kids, they don't vote.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It's the fall of the Roman Empire, are you blind?  And we're putting fig leaves on the statues ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Yeah ... Sullivan thinks Henry's leaking.  He's the one ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Yeah, I knew it.  I knew it from '69 on, and I said it all along, didn't I ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Who's gonna tell Mitchell?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: You do it.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: 'Cause he hates you.  It's worse when you get it from someone you trust.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He's wrong, you know -- about Kennedy, LBJ, Truman.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Sure, they did stuff, but nothing like this, Bob.  Forget Watergate, the break-ins, the Enemies list.  You got an attempted firebombing at the Brookings Institution, planting McGovern stuff on the guy that shot Wallace, trying to slip LSD to Jack Anderson.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: The "Old Man" plays politics harder than anybody else.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: You think this is just about politics?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It's a code or something.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: I figured that out.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: I think he means the Kennedy assassination.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: They went after Castro.  In some crazy way it got turned on Kennedy.  I don't think the "P" knows what happened, but he's afraid to find out.  It's got him shitting peach pits.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Christ, we created Frankenstein with those fucking Cubans.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Eight words back in '72 -- "I covered up.  I was wrong.  I'm sorry" -- and the American public would've forgiven him.  But we never opened our mouths, John.  We failed him.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Dick Nixon saying "I'm sorry"? That'll be the day.  The whole suit of armor'd fall off.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: So you tell Mitchell ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Colson doesn't know about it; he's pure as a virgin on this one.  It's just not clear the burglars knew what they were looking for.  They were heading to McGovern's office later that night.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Jesus!  Did Mitchell know?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Mitchell's out of his mind now. Martha just put her head through a plate-glass window.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Jesus!  Through a window?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Martha's an idiot, she'll do anything to get John's attention.  If Mitchell'd been minding the store instead of that nut Martha we wouldn't have that kid Magruder runnin' some third-rate burglary!  Was he smoking pot?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Mitchell?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No!  Magruder!  That sonofabitch tests my Quaker patience to the breaking point.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: McCord? ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Find out what the hell he was doing at "CREEP."  This could be trouble. These CIA guys don't miss a trick. This could be a set-up.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I don't have time for all this shit!  Just handle it, Bob!  Keep it out of the White House.  What else? Kissinger's waiting -- he's gonna throw a tantrum again if I don't see him, threatening to quit ... again.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Well, sir ... it turns out -- one of the people implicated is still, you see, on our White House payroll.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Who?  Not another goddamn Cuban?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Hunt?  Howard Hunt?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He left his White House phone number in his hotel room.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Goddamn! How long have we had this fucking dog?!  Two years, he still doesn't come!  We need a dog that looks happy when the press is around.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Well, he's photogenic.  Let's try dog bones?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I like it.  I like the idea.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Is it legal?  I mean has anyone ever done it before?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Sure.  Lyndon, JFK, FDR -- I mean, Truman cut the shit out of my investigation of Hiss back in '48.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Where's Hunt now?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: In hiding.  He sent Liddy to talk to me.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He wants money.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Pay him.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Pay him?  I told him to get out of the country.  It's crazy to start ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: What the hell are you doing, Ehrlichman?  Screwing with the CIA?  I don't care how much he wants -- pay him.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's more than that.  It could be more than that.  I want Hunt paid.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Uh, we've never done this before, sir ... How do we pay?  In ... hundreds?  Do you fill a black bag full of unmarked bills?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: This is not a joke, John!

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We should set up a Cuban defense fund on this; take care of all of them.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Oh, I suppose you would've just let them take over.  These aren't fraternity pranks, John.  It's anarchy.  A revolution!

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: I don't know if I'd go that far, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Is the war worth it?  Is it worth a one-term presidency?  Because I think right now that's what we're looking at.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I will not go down as the first American president to lose a war! Going into Cambodia, bombing Hanoi, bombing Laos -- it buys us time so we can get out and give the South Vietnamese a fighting chance.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Excuse me ... Are you talking about recognizing China, Mr. President? That would cost us our strongest support.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No ... I can do this because I've spent my whole career building anti Communist credentials.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We can't touch Hoover --

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: I thought the gloves were off.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: -- as long as he's got secret files on everybody.  I don't want 'em used against us.  What about the CIA?  Helms's done nothing for us.  I want to see him.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The soldiers were provoked.  The students started it, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Sir, there's dead American kids here. Let's say we don't apologize for Kent State, but maybe we could have a national prayer day ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He's in the dumps, sir.  Agnew.  Every time you have him attack the press, they give it back to him in spades. He's become the most hated man in America.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Yeah, good old Spiro.  Well, better him than me.  What the hell is he but an insurance policy?

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He's begging for a meeting, chief.  He wants to go overseas for awhile.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Well, no place where they speak English.  That way he can always say he was misquoted.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: The country's loving it.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The hard-core four million "Nixon nuts" aren't gonna go for it ... They'll say I sold out to the Communists.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No, you didn't, Bob.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Looks like he talked to Joe Kraft ... and to the Times.  Told them he was dead set against the bombing, that you were ... "unstable."  Claims he has to handle you "with kid gloves" ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: I would personally enjoy doing that, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No, no.  He's our only "star" right now.  He'd go crying straight to the press.  He'd crucify us -- the sonofabitch!  Get someone from our staff on his ass. Tap his phones.  I want to know everyone he talks to.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I end the longest war in American history and they keep harping on this chickenshit!  You know who's behind this, don't you -- it's Teddy Kennedy! He drowns a broad in his car and he can't run for president.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: He got pretty burned at Chappaquiddick.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: My point exactly!  Somebody had to die before his shit got in the paper! Fucking Kennedys get away with everything.  Do you see me screwing everything that moves?  For Christ's sake!  I did what the New York Times editorial page said we should do!  I ended the war, I got SALT I with the Russians, I opened China!  So why are these cocksuckers turning on me?  Because they don't like the way I look.  Where I went to school.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: What about England?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Forget it.  Ehrenberg's paid three times that much ...

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: It'll never wash.  Pardoning them means we're guilty.  The people, the press will go nuts.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: And what am I supposed to do?  Just sit here and watch them coming closer? Eating their way to the center?  Lyndon bugged!  So did Kennedy!  FDR cut a deal with Lucky Luciano. Christ, even Ike had a mistress! What's so special about me?  What about Lyndon?  He could make a couple of calls to the Hill and shut this whole thing down.  Did anyone talk to him?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I don't know, I don't know ... I just know we've made too many enemies.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Sir, Bob and I are gonna have to testify before Earvin's committee.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No, you're not!  You're going to claim executive privilege and you're going to stonewall it all the way -- plead the Fifth Amendment.  I don't give a shit.  They can't force the President's people to testify.

turns.speaker: EHRLICHMAN
turns.text: Executive privilege will make it look like we're covering up.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We are covering up!  For some petty, stupid shit.  There are things I can say -- when other people say them, they'd be lies. But when I say them nobody believes me anyway ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: This is June twentieth?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: It's marked.  Also there's June twenty third.  And this year -- March twenty first.  Those are the ones ...

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Sorry ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... go on.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... Y'know Al, if Hoover was alive none of this would've happened.  He would've protected the President.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Mr. Hoover was a realist.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I trusted Mitchell.  It was that damn big mouth wife of his.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: At least Mitchell stood up to it.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Not like the others -- Dean, McCord, the rest ... We never got our side of the story out, Al.  People've forgotten.  I mean: "Fuck you, Mr. President, fuck you Tricia, fuck you Julie!" and all that shit, just words, but what violence!  The tear gassing, the riots, burning the draft cards, Black Panthers -- we fixed it, Al, and they hate me for it -- the double dealing bastards.  They lionize that traitor, Ellsberg, for stealing secrets, but they jump all over me 'cause it's Nixon.  ... They've always hated Nixon.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: May I say something, Mr. President?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: There's no secrets here, Al.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: You've never been a greater example to the country than you are now, sir, but ... but you need to get out more, sir, and talk to the people.  No one I know feels ... close to you.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: No, sir, you did not.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Damn right.  And there's still a helluva lotta people out there who wanna believe ... That's the point, isn't it?  They wanna believe in the President.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: You're all set, sir.  Just push this button.  Good night, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: You know, Al, men in your profession ... you give 'em a pistol and you leave the room.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: I don't have a pistol.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: 'Night, Al.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Exactly!  We've got to take the war to them.  Hit 'em where it hurts -- right in the nuts.  More assassinations, more killings.  Right, Al?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: That's what they're doing.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: These State Department jerks, Bill, don't understand; you got to electrify people with bold moves.  Bold moves make history, like Teddy Roosevelt -- "T.R." -- rushing up San Juan Hill.  Small event but dramatic.  People took notice.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's the President's personal property!  I will never give up my tapes to a bunch of Kennedy-loving Harvard Democrat cocksuckers!

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: This could trigger the impeachment. They'll go to the Supreme Court next.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Let 'em try!  I appointed three of those bastards!  I'm not giving 'em my tapes!

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Can the president afford to ignore a subpoena?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Who the fuck does Cox think he is?  I never made a dime from public office!  I'm honest.  My dad died broke.  You know the sonofabitch went to law school with Jack Kennedy? ... The last gasp of the Establishment! They got the hell kicked out of 'em in the election, so now they gotta squeal about Watergate 'cause we were the first real threat to them in years. And by God, Al, we would have changed it, changed it so they couldn't have changed it back in a hundred years, if only ...

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Congress is considering four articles of impeachment, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: For what?!

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: About a dozen.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: A dozen?  I got half of 'em elected. I still got the South and Goldwater and his boys.  I'll take my chances with the Senate.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Cox!  Fire him.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: But he works for the Attorney General. Only Richardson can fire him.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Richardson won't do that.  He'll resign.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The hell he will!  Fire him, too.  If you have to go all the way down to the janitor at the Justice Department, fire the sonofabitch!  And ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... an action that will at last, once and for all, show that what I knew and what I did with regard to the Watergate break-in and cover-up were just as I have described them to you from the very beginning ...

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: He's completely lost touch with reality.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I had no knowledge of the cover-up until John Dean told me about it on March twenty-first.  And I did not intend that payment to Hunt or anyone else be made ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: "Victory at Sea," Al ... Henry.  The Pacific Theatre.  Christ, you can almost feel the waves breaking over the decks.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: I'm afraid we have another problem, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: June twenty-third, '72, sir.  The part that's underlined.  Your instructions to Haldeman regarding the CIA and the FBI.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Your lawyers feel it's the ... "smoking gun."

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's totally out of context.  I was protecting the national security.  I never intended --

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Sir, the deadline is today.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Can we get around this, Al?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: It's the Supreme Court, sir; you don't get around it.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: If you resign, you can keep your tapes as a private citizen ... You can fight them for years.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: And if I stay?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The army?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Lincoln used it.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: That was civil war.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: How do you see this?

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: We can't survive this, sir.  They also have you instructing Dean to make the payoff to Hunt.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: There is nothing in that statement the President can't explain.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Sir, you talked about opening up the whole "Bay of Pigs" thing again.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: That's right ...

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Three days before, on the June twentieth tape -- the one with the eighteen-minute gap --

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I don't know anything about that.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: ... you mentioned the "Bay of Pigs" several times.  Sooner or later they're going to want to know what that means.  They're going to want to know what was on that gap ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's gone.  No one will ever find out what's on it.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... they smelled the blood on me this time, Al.  I got soft.  You know ... that rusty, metallic smell ...

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: I know it well, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It came over from Vietnam, you know.

turns.speaker: HAIG
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: That smell.  I mean, everybody suffered so much, their sons killed. They need to sacrifice something, y'know, appease the gods of war -- Mars, Jupiter.  I am that blood, General.  I am that sacrifice, in the highest place of all ... All leaders must finally be sacrificed.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: They did what?!  I don't understand. Why'd they go into O'Brien's office in the first place?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Evidently to install bugs and photograph documents.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: But O'Brien doesn't even use that office.  The Democrats've moved to Miami.  There's nothing there!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It was just a fishing expedition. Apparently it was their fourth attempt at the DNC.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Their fourth!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It's possible they were looking for evidence of an illegal Howard Hughes donation to the Democrats, so the Democrats couldn't make an issue of your Hughes money.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Contributions!  It was a legal contribution.  Who the hell authorized this?  Colson?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: We feel the bigger concern is Gordon Liddy ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: That fruitcake!  What about him?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Well, you know, sir, he's a nut.  He used to work here with the "Plumbers" and now he's running this Watergate caper.  You remember his plan to firebomb the Brookings using Cubans as firemen?  He wanted to buy a damned fire truck!  Magruder thinks he's just nutty enough to go off the reservation.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: What's Liddy got?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Apparently he was using some campaign cash that was laundered for us through Mexico.  The FBI's onto it.  We could have a problem with that.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: He works for Colson.  He used him on the Pentagon Papers.  We're trying to figure out when he officially stopped being a White House consultant.  After the arrest he dumped his wiretapping stuff into his White House safe.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Howard Hunt is working for the White House?  No shit!  This is goddamn Disneyland!  Since when?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: On the list of horribles, I know what he is.  And I know what he tracks back to.  You say he was involved in the Plumbers?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Definitely.  Colson had him trying to break into Bremer's apartment after Bremer shot Wallace, to plant McGovern campaign literature.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I had nothing to do with that.  Was he ... in the Ellsberg thing?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Yes, you approved it, sir.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: It was right after the Pentagon Papers broke.  They went in to get his psychiatric records.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Fucking hell.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: We were working on China.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Well, why not?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Our own intelligence capability -- to fix the leaks?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Howard Hunt? ... Jesus Christ, you open up that scab ... and you uncover a lot of pus.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: What do you mean, sir?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: But what are we paying him for?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Silence!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: But, sir, you're covered -- no one here gave orders to break into the damned Watergate.  We're clean.  It's only the Ellsberg thing, and if that comes out, it's "national security."

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: "Security" is not strong enough.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: How about a COMINT classification?  We put it on the Huston plan.  Even the designation is classified.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: "National Priority."

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: "National security priority restricted and controlled secret."

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: We'll work on it.  I say we cut ourselves loose from these clowns and that's all there is to it.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Should we talk to Trini about paying these guys?  Or maybe Chotiner?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No, keep Trini out of this. Chotiner's too old.  And for God's sake, keep Colson out.  It's time to baptize our young counsel.  That means Dean can never talk about it.  Attorney-client privilege.  Get to it.  And Dean -- you stay close on this.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Bob, did I approve the Ellsberg thing? You know, I'm glad we tape all these conversations because ... I never approved that break-in at Ellsberg's psychiatrist.  Or maybe I approved it after the fact?  Someday we've got to start transcribing the tapes.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: You approved that before the fact, because I went over it with you.  But ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Uh, no one, of course, is going to see these tapes, but ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: That's right, and it's more a problem for Ehrlichman.  He fixed Hunt up with the phony CIA ID's, but ... what else does Hunt have on us?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: We've got to turn off the FBI.  You just go to the CIA, Bob, and tell Helms that Howard Hunt is blackmailing the President.  Tell him that Hunt and his Cuban friends know too damn much, and if he goes public, it would be a fiasco for the CIA.  He'll know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Play it tough.  That's the way they play it and that's the way we're going to play it.  Don't lie to Helms and say there's no involvement, but just say this is sort of a comedy of errors, bizarre, without getting into it.  Say the President believes it's going to open up the whole Bay of Pigs thing again.  Tell Helms he should call the FBI, call Pat Gray, and say that we wish for the sake of the country -- don't go any further into this hanky-panky, period!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: The Bay of Pigs? ... That was Kennedy's screw-up.  How does that threaten us?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Just do what I say, Bob.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Yes, sir, but ... do you think Gray'll go for it?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Pat Gray'll do anything we ask him. That's why I appointed him.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: He'll need a pretext.  He'll never figure one out for himself.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Christ, you're right -- Gray makes Jerry Ford look like Mozart.  Just have Helms call him.  Helms can scare anybody.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: The only problem with that, sir -- it gets us into obstruction of justice.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's got nothing to do with justice. It's national security.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: How is this national security?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Because the President says it is.  My job is to protect this country from its enemies, and its enemies are inside the walls.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I suppose you thought the Presidency was above this sort of thing.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: This isn't a "moral" issue, Bob.  We have to keep our enemies at bay or our whole program is gonna go down the tubes.  The FBI is filled with people who are pissed that I put Gray in and not one of their own.  Vietnam, China, the Soviet Union: when you look at the big picture, Bob, you'll see we're doing a hell of a lotta good in this world.  Let's not screw it up with some shit-ass, third-rate burglary.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: I'll talk to Helms.  Oh, Pat asked if you're coming to the Residence for dinner tonight.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No, no, not tonight.  Don't let her in here.  I have too much to do.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I'll talk to Helms, and, uh ... what's our press position on this Watergate thing?  What do I tell Ziegler to tell them?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... When we consider the lineup of the world, we find there are 590 million people on our side, 800 million on the Communist side, and 600 million who are neutral.  The odds are 5 to 3 against us ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: He wouldn't do the makeup.  Said it was for queers.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I think ... I think ... that's the sort of very dangerous and irresponsible suggestion that ... helping the Cuban exiles who oppose Castro would, uh ... not only be a violation of international law, it would be ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: He's treading water.  Don't mention Khrushchev.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... an open invitation for Mr. Khrushchev to become involved in Latin America.  We would lose all our friends in Latin America.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Meanwhile, what happens to the country?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The bastard!  If I'd called his shot on Cuba I would've won.  He made me look soft.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Dick, you don't have to make a statement.  Herb covered it for you.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Cue the crowd.  Go to the woman's group.  Get the bald guy, he's great ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I, unlike Senator Kennedy, have a plan to end the war.  But not for peace at any price, but peace with honor!

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: He wasn't protecting me.  He was putting me on notice.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: What?  That he knew Johnny Roselli? Hoover knew a lot of gangsters.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Yeah, but Roselli wasn't just any gangster.  He was the gangster who set up Track 2 in Cuba.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: I don't understand.  Track 2's Chile?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Chile, Congo, Guatemala, Cuba. Wherever's there's a need for an Executive Action capability, there's a Track 2.  In Cuba, Track 1 was the Bay of Pigs invasion.  Track 2 ... it was our idea.  We felt the invasion wouldn't work unless we got rid of Castro.  So we asked ourselves -- who else wants Castro dead?  The Mafia, the money people.   So we put together Track 2 ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: The first assassination attempt was in '60, just before the election.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Before?!  Eisenhower approved that?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: He didn't veto it.  I ran the White House side.  The mob contact was Johnny Roselli.  One of the CIA guys was that jackass, Howard Hunt.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: And not just Hunt.  Frank Sturgis, all those Cubans.  All of them in the Watergate.  They were involved in Track 2 in Cuba.  Hunt reported to my military aide. But I met with him several times as Vice President.  That's what worries the shit out of me.  I don't know how much Hunt knows.  Or the Cubans.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: So?  You wanted Castro dead. Everybody wanted Castro dead.  If Hunt and the others are CIA, why don't we just throw this back in the CIA's lap? Let Richard Helms take the fall?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Because ... because Dick Helms knows too much ... If anyone in this country knows more than I do, it's Hoover and Helms!  You don't fuck with Dick Helms!  Period.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Alright.  But why, if Kennedy is so clean in all this, didn't he cancel Track 2?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Because he didn't even know about it. The CIA never told him, they just kept it going.  It was like ... it had a life of its own.  Like ... a kind of "beast" that doesn't even know it exists.  It just eats people when it doesn't need 'em anymore.  Two days after the Bay of Pigs, Kennedy called me in.  He reamed my ass ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... he'd just found out about Track 2.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: You never told him?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I didn't want him to get the credit. He said I'd stabbed him in the back. Called me a two-bit grocery clerk from Whittier.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: If they didn't tell Kennedy about Track 2, how did Hoover find out?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: They had us bugged.  Christ, he had everybody bugged.  Yeah, he was gonna support me in '68, but he was also threatening me.  That was Hoover: he'd give you the carrot, but he'd make damn sure the stick went right up your ass.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Well, one way or the other, Kent State is not good.  We have to get out in front of this thing.  The PR is going to murder us.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Money.  Follow the money.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: These kids are being manipulated by the Communists.  Like Chambers and Hiss.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: ... never complain, never explain, John ...

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: I tell you, the soldiers were provoked.  Now stop this pussyfooting around.  Dead kids!  How the hell did we ever give the Democrats a weapon like this?  I mean, if Cambodia doesn't work, we'll bomb Hanoi if we have to.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: ... and we've got the economic guys at five.  The Dow lost another 16 points. They're going to want a decision on the budget.  Sir?  ... Are we holding the line on a balanced budget?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: No ... a little deficit won't hurt. Jesus, they're serious.  Why're we stopping?

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Run 'em over.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Get that little fucker!  Great tackle! Reminds me of my days at Whittier. Most of these kids are useless.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Probably flunking, nothing to do except come down here and meet girls. Henry's out there with them.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: There's a poison in the upper classes, Bob.  They've had it too soft.  Too many cars, too many color TVs ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Don't forget the South, sir, the West. Filled with the good football colleges, straight kids.  There's more of 'em with you than against you.  Not like these mudmutts.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's the parents' fault really.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: But, hell, this is nothing compared to Venezuela.  When I was Vice President, Ike sent me down there like a blocking back.  They threw rocks, broke out our windows, almost overturned the car. Read Six Crises, Bob.  Boy, Pat was brave!

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Yeah, we've got to get our vice president off the golf course and back there on the college circuit.  That's top priority.

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Mr. President!

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: It's okay, Bob, we're just rapping, my friends and I.  We actually agree on a lot of things ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: We really must go, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: Don't forget, the most important thing in your life is your relationship with your Maker ...  Don't forget to be on God's side.

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: She got it, Bob.  A nineteen-year-old college kid ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: She understood something it's taken me twenty-five fucking years in politics to understand.  The CIA, the Mafia, the Wall Street bastards ...

turns.speaker: HALDEMAN
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: NIXON
turns.text: ... "The Beast."  A nineteen-year-old kid.  She understands the nature of "the Beast."  She called it a wild animal.
